0660/A0/04/003/007.status_value: 5   The advanced inclusive education courses are fully integrated into pre- and in-service teacher training curricula (since early 2015).  The three training manuals on low vision  intellectual disabilities and hearing impairments are used as reference tools  complementing the existing basic inclusive education manual.
0660/A0/04/003/007.indicator_name: Special Education courses are integrated into pre- and in-service teacher training

0660/A0/04/003/007.status_value: 3.7% (urban) and 5.4% (rural)   The primary repetition rate in urban areas increased marginally from 3.5% to 3.7% since last year and the rural rate increased from 5.1 to 5.4%.  This is in line with other trends in the sector which are due to the strengthening of the management of the sector resulting in more reliable EMIS data.
0660/A0/04/003/007.indicator_name: Primary repetition rates (disaggregated by urban and rural areas)

0660/A0/04/003/007.status_value: 14.3% (urban) and 22.9% (rural)   Lower secondary dropout remains a concern with a stagnant rate of 14.3 per cent in urban areas and a slight decrease in rural areas from 23.2% to 22.9% since last year achieving the low target. The national rate was 21.0% and 20.3% for girls. The MoEYS UNICEF Out of School Children Initiative will identify strategies to address this ongoing issue linked to the growth of the private sector and the perceived low rate of return on lower secondary.
0660/A0/04/003/007.indicator_name: Lower secondary dropout rates (disaggregated by urban and rural areas)

0660/A0/04/003/007.status_value: 67% of lower secondary schools were assessed   The revised CFS checklist has been tested in 271 out of 403 lower secondary schools in the 6 target provinces and  assessed against the CFS standards. Of the 271 schools  113 are considered to have achieved a rank of ¿basic¿ (42%)  128 (47%) are ¿medium¿ and 30 (11%) are considered ¿advanced¿ against the CFS criteria.
0660/A0/04/003/007.indicator_name: Percentage of lower secondary schools that are annually assessed against  MoEYS's Child Friendly School (CFS) Standards

0660/A0/04/003/008.status_value: 65.2% average NER across 30 weakest districts  In 2014/2015  there was a 29.3 percentage point difference between the national primary NER of 94.5% and the average NER of the 30 weakest districts. This increased from 23 percentage points in 2013/2014.  This shows the need for district-level planning and implementation to develop tailored interventions to increase participation.

0660/A0/04/003/008.status_value: 90.3%   The execution rate reduced from 93% in 2013 to 90.3% in 2014 . Nevertheless  there was a net increase of 30 per cent in the total education budget rising to US$346 million (recurrent) in 2014.  It is widely acknowledged that the quality of the spending has improved although execution has decreased
0660/A0/04/003/008.indicator_name: Execution rate of the education budget

0660/A0/04/003/008.status_value: 100 out of 197 districts have a primary completion rate of at least 80% (51% of all districts)   In 2013/2014  130 districts achieved a primary completion rate of at least 80 per cent while in 2014/2015 only 100 districts achieved this. This may partly be due to the fact that over-aged children have already dropped out by the time they reach Grade 6 meaning that the overall completion rate reduces.
0660/A0/04/003/008.indicator_name: Percentage of districts achieving a primary completion rate of at least 80%
0660/A0/04/003/008.baseline_value: 130 districts have primary completion rates of at least 80%

0660/A0/04/003/008.status_value: Partially   The new integrated database using more complex software (MySQL Server) was rolled-out in 25 provinces for data entry. Due to some technical issues  the web-based database is being implemented partially in all provinces in conjunction with the old EMIS system of `Visual dBase'  SPSS and Excel in order to produce the EMIS report.  This issue will be supported further in 2016/2017 as data collection and entry increasingly become digital.
0660/A0/04/003/008.indicator_name: Roll out of web-based integrated EMIS system with comprehensive and disaggregated data
